title: Medidata data documentation
text: clinical data medidata consists multiple tables; section shown corresponds different data table. Click triangle expand data table see individual fields. first 10 tables shown, click page numbers see tables search search bar field interest.

title: Medidata data documentation
text: single date field generally captured 6 variables. example, treatment table field exstdat (treatment start date) :

title: Medidata data documentation
text: See tables priorrx (medical history/prior treatments) table ideally contains prostate cancer treatments patient’s medical history, informed consent signed IRONMAN study. treatment (cancer treatment) table contains prostate cancer treatment ongoing time informed consent treatments started study. completion guidelines entry, sometimes site may enter wrong form tables referenced get full view cancer treatment. forms EDC (electronic data capture) log line forms; record_position order entry form, represent anything beyond (.e., represent therapy order).

title: Medidata data documentation
text: possible, treatment regimens mapped standardized coding master treatment mapping file. master list created identifying yet mapped treatments personnel researching drug class, confirmed QC’d medical monitors question. treatment mapping continuously updated. Standardized treatment mapping contained priorrx_derived treatment_derived. two tables contain information original priorrx treatment tables, additionally provide: priorrxreg_lower, treatment_lower: entry lower case priorrx_treatment_recode, trt_treatment_recode: assigned standardized coding priorrx_treatment_category, trt_treatment_category: assigned treatment category priorrx_is_taxel, trt_is_taxel: treatment one Cabazitaxel, Docetaxel, Paclitaxel, Tesetaxel priorrx_is_nha, trt_is_nha : treatment novel hormonal agent (one Abiraterone, Enzalutamide, Darolutamide, Apalutamide)

title: Medidata data documentation
text: 6 computed / derived Gleason scores. general, gleason scores consist gleason 1 (max value 5) gleason 2 (max value 5) gleason sum (max value 10) However, sites occasionally enter Gleason sum either first Gleason scores. cleaned derived Gleason scores gleason 1 gleason 2 less equal five, total gleason score sum two first gleason score greater five, total gleason score taken first gleason score instance table multiple gleason scores per subject (e.g., study biopsy), largest gleason score sum carried forward subject table.

title: Medidata data documentation
text: designation participant baseline metastatic looks across seven different tables. subject table: is_metastatic_baseline = 1 least one seven tables indicates presence metastatic disease origin_metastatic_baseline indicates want indicated metastatic status across seven tables date_metastatic_baseline earliest date metastatic flag recorded across seven tables

title: Medidata data documentation
text: genetic testing results available? IRONMAN collects genetic testing reports. new CRF implemented November 2022 better capture deliver genetic information, pending completion sites yet ready delivered.

title: PROMS data documentation
text: PROMS self-report questionnaire IRONMAN study. data deliveries work progress efficiently meet needs involved partners. survey consists multiple instruments. instruments also multiple versions.

title: PROMS data documentation
text: survey instruments contained single data file; section shown corresponds survey instrument. Click triangle expand survey instrument see invidual questions.

title: PROMS data documentation
text: Demographic questions asked across two different instruments (irondemog irondemog_v3). Due common usage race/ethnicity, questions combined two instruments analysis convenience. noted irondemog combined instrument, well medidata subject table. race.26.x (select question, x indicates numeric select option) race.26.1 coalesces values irondemog.26.1 irondemog_v3.26.1 race.26.2 coalesces values irondemog.26.2 irondemog_v3.26.2 etc. ethnicity.27, multiple choice question. coalesced irondemog.27 irondemog_v3.27

title: PROMS data documentation
text: Survey respondents asked height weight two part question. First, enter numeric value height weight, second enter unit measurement (inches/cm pounds/kg). measurements kept separate variables according unit indicated. Note also two different instruments, coalesced analysis. irondemog.3.1, irondemog_v3.3.1: height inches irondemog.3.2, irondemog_v3.3.2: height cm irondemog.5.1, irondemog_v3.5.1: weight pounds irondemog.5.2, irondemog_v3.5.2: weight kg

title: PROMS data documentation
text: 1. FACT-FPSI, 2 questions recorded (factfpsi_1 factfpsi_2)? Confirmed data set protocol 2 questions collected. 2. BPI, one two questions found. (ironmisc_12 ironmisc_13 ironmisc_v5_15 ironmisc_v5_16). Please advise process . responses combined across two protocol versions get complete set. 3. ironmisc indication questionnaire name? ironmisc questions miscellaneous questions part formal instrument; presented patients “feel, memory, sleep quality, pain”.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: line therapy (lot) algorithm approximately assigns line therapy based logic described . manual review process, identified situations results algorithm align line therapy assessment domain expertise. making algorithm available hopes can provide rough approximation, please note gold standard truth. PCCTC working towards electronic data base updates easily accurately collect line therapy information. current version algorithm reasonably sufficient extract first line therapy.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: Identify data interest. intent priorrx table capture treatments prior study start treatment capture study treatments, always happen. good practice stack tables create full treatment history filter dates relevant. Overall line therapy: stack priorrx_derived treatment_derived tables create full listing prior current treatments. study line therapy: either use treatment_derived tables stack priorrx_derived treatment_derived filter treatments occur consent date. Disease state line therapy: researchers may interested line therapy specific disease state diagnosis, like mHSPC. , stack priorrx_derived treatment_derived filter treatments occur disease state diagnosis. Remove rows priorrx_treatment_category/trt_treatment_category equal “ADT”, “Bisphosphonates”, “Steroid”, generally considered standalone line therapy. start date listed, remove row consideration; future data cuts hopefully queried information available.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: assign_lot() internally. Sort table treatment start date, assign first line (1L) first entry, along entries occur within 30 day window date combo therapy. End line 1 (subsequent lines) treatment stop date listed therapies line. end date entered, use information step 8 new LOT entered. new treatments listed 30 days LOT start date become new LOT. treatments listed within 30 days new LOT start marked combo therapy LOT. Repeat LOTs assigned patient.

title: Line of therapy algorithm
text: demonstration situation 1: “Overall line therapy.” Note takes minutes complete. prepared data looks like single subject: Example results subject. Note individual treatments still retained. can reduce data set summarized treatment regimens. subject appear :
code: library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(ironer) # stack prior treatments with on study treatments # rename variables to match between two data sets treatment_prep <- medidata$priorrx_derived %>%    select(     subject, treatment = priorrxreg,      exstdat_int = priorrxstdt_int,      exendat_int = priorrxenddt_int,      treatment_recode = priorrx_treatment_recode,      treatment_category = priorrx_treatment_category   ) %>%   # create variable to indicate origin of data   mutate(source = "priorrx") %>%    # stack on study treatments   bind_rows(     medidata$treatment_derived %>%        select(         subject, treatment, exstdat_int, exendat_int,          treatment_recode = trt_treatment_recode, treatment_category = trt_treatment_category       ) %>%        # create variable to indicate origin of data       mutate(source = "treatment")   ) %>%   # remove entries with missing start date   filter(!is.na(exstdat_int)) %>%    # remove treatments not counted as a line of therapy   filter(!trt_treatment_category %in% c("Steroid", "Bone-Modifying Agent", "Bisphosphonates", "Antidiabetic")) |>    # keep relevant fields  select(subject, exstdat_int, exendat_int, treatment_category, treatment_recode, source) # assign line of therapy  treatment_lot <- treatment_prep %>%    # sort by subject and treatment start date   arrange(subject, exstdat_int) %>%   # within each subject, assign line of therapy   group_by(subject) %>%   group_modify(~ ironer::assign_lot(     .data = .x,      # note, you could use treatment_category here as well to get a high level     # view of line of therapy by category     treatment = treatment_recode,     dt_trt_observed = exstdat_int,      dt_treatment_end = exendat_int     )) |>    ungroup() treatment_lot_summary <- treatment_lot |>    select(subject, lot, regimen, dt_lot_start, dt_lot_last_obs) |>    distinct()

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
text: dataset containing treatment mapping specific PCCTC studies, intended updated regularly. mapping needs corrected added, please file issue contact PCCTC. Note mapping already priorrx_derived treatment_derived tables.

title: Treatment mapping — treatment_map
text: data frame 5 variables: treatment Treatment submitted study treatment_lower Treatment submitted study lower case treatment_recode Assigned treatment standardized coding treatment_category Assigned treatment category is_taxel Indicates treatment taxel (one Cabazitaxel, Docetaxel, Paclitaxel, Tesetaxel) is_nha Indicates treatment novel hormone agent (one Abiraterone, Enzalutamide, Darolutamide, Apalutamide)
